jcr:content.jcr:title: She's a Park Explorer at Pumpkin Hill Creek Preserve State Park- DBJ

data.details:
She’s a Park Explorer at Pumpkin Hill Creek Preserve State Park- DBJ
Grades: K, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

Welcome to the wet and wild world of Pumpkin Hill Creek Preserve State Park. Today, we will be learning about the importance of this upland area as a wetland buffer preserve for Jacksonville’s water. Over 4,000 acres of forest, swamps and marsh are protected as a filter for our fresh water. Rangers protect the conservation area and work to restore and maintain habitats. Learn about the different methods we employ including wetland monitoring and prescribed fire. Hands-on activities will include water conservation games, water sampling and a fire engine demonstration. Fun patch provided. Park entrance fee included.

*This event is for 2016 registered Girl Scouts, and registered & approved adult volunteers.
* For safety and supervision reasons, troops and individuals are not permitted to bring non-Girl Scouts or siblings. 
*Girl/adult ratios must be followed and adults are expected to stay on the premises during the event. 
*Event registration closes Feb. 1

$8/girl, $8/adult
Contact: Brittany McCallister 904.389.3071
data.locationLabel: Pumpkin Hill Creek Preserve State Park
